medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe epigastric pain for the past five days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began spontaneously 5 days ago with severe burning epigastric pain that is non-radiating. The pain worsens with fluid intake, is unimproved by position changes, and resolves spontaneously. Additionally, there is a reported decreased appetite during this time. The patient has also experienced approximately 20 lbs weight loss over the past 6 months without actively trying to lose weight. Denies nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea but reports bright red blood per rectum (BRBPR) after a rectal exam and has not had a bowel movement in about one week.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypertriglyceridemia, sleep apnea, hemorrhoids, atypical chest pain, GERD, ADHD, depression/anxiety.
medical_history.family_history: Father with colon cancer and coronary artery disease; both hypertension and diabetes mellitus present on both sides of the family.
